results.title: Feast of St. Isidore and The Horrors of war (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Luciano Emmer, Sergio Amidei and Colonna Film
results.brief_description: This film is more that a record of Goya’s work; it is also an interpretation of the philosophy of the man himself. Two sharply differing aspects are depicted: in “The Feast of St Isidore” Goya sketched the festivities in Madrid, the excitement of the bullfight and the mixed adoration and fear in the faces of the people at the evening procession of the Virgin; in “The Horrors of War” Goya depicted all the cruelty, fear and violence of the Napoleonic invasion and the grief and pain which followe it. The film concludes with a vision of drawings showing the sadness and futility of human existence.

results.title: The Feast
results.creator_credit: Timothy Asch and Documentary Educational Resources
results.brief_description: Illustrates the feasting practices of the Yanomamo Indians of southern Venezuela, at the headwaters of the Orinoco River. These feasts provide an opportunity for the forming of alliances between independent sovereign villages. Based on Chapter IV of Napoleon Chagnon’s ethnographic work, Yanomano: the fierce people.

results.title: Emotions of every-day living. No. 3. Fears of children
results.creator_credit: Francis Thompson, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A film about Paul, a normal five-year-old and his well-intentioned parents. In a series of episodes typical of those arising in families with small children, it shows how Paul’s fears are related to his feelings about his parents. Fears not only prevent him from enjoying experiences other boys enjoy, but tend to widen the gap of mnisunderstanding between him and his parents. The film points out that Paul’s feelings are common to children of his age and may be accentuated when parents become either unduly protective or over severe.

results.title: Fear woman
results.creator_credit: Elspeth MacDougall and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: A documentary about the status of women in Ghana, noting their reputation for independence. Points out that the women run a large part of the retail trade of the country, and that they are beginning to enter into areas which have power and influence.

results.title: F.D.R. 1882-1945
results.brief_description: A tribute to Franklin Delano Roosevelt, four times President of the United States, born 1882, died 1945, one of the most famous Americans. Using archival footage, the film gives an interesting insight into modern American history.

results.title: The F.B.I.
results.creator_credit: Fortune Films, Time-Life Films and Time Inc
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Describes the 24-hour-a-day vigilance of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, the techniques and crime detection methods shown at the F.B.I. laboratories, and the rigorous training an agent must undergo. Dramatizes the case of the Nazi spy, August Baumeyer, and illustrates the effectiveness of counter-espionage by the F.B.I. Features F.B.I. Director, John Edgar Hoover.

results.title: The Fauves
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell and Victoria. Education Dept. Audio-Visual Resources Branch
results.brief_description: The Fauves were a group of artists centred around Henri Matisse, who worked together for a period of two years. The style was a mixture of technique with features derived from Sevrat, Van Gogh and later, Gauguin. The Fauves proclaimed the value of the formal elements in a painting. Their ideas greatly influenced the course of twentieth century art intended to be a stimulating resource material for senior art students. Music by Claude Debussy, Alexander Scriabin and Alan Hovhaness.

results.title: Father of the man
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Looks at the first results of a survey probing Freud’s claim that the child is psychologically “father of the man”. Discusses the elaborate techniques which have been used to penetrate the secret thoughts of children, and which are giving insights into Freud’s theories.

results.title: Father and daughter
results.creator_credit: Corinne Hart, Lucy Liu Brown, Karl Holtsnider, Franciscan Communications and Teleketics
results.brief_description: When Dr. Cortum, a devout Catholic and a medical doctor, discovered that his 18 year old daughter Michelle was experimenting with drugs he asked her to leave home rather than give a bad example to their younger children. Eventually she joined the Society For Krishna Consciousness and her lifestyle is now considerably more disciplined than before. Explores through candid interviews the past and present relationship of Dr Cortum and his daughter. Also examines what it means to stand for one’s beliefs or moral principles.
